metadata.unit_designation: Xxi Corpo D Armata Xxi Corps

narrative.title: Xxi Corpo D Armata Xxi Corps - 1941Q3
narrative.situation: Italian Colonial Infantry Corps deployed in North Africa during 1941Q3.
narrative.objectives: Colonial infantry corps responsible for Tobruk siege operations and static defense of Cyrenaica region. XXI Corps tasked by Rommel (end July 1941) with 'establishing the siege belt of Fortress Tobruk, to avoid the escape of the defenders, and to prepare the conquest.' Static defense posture with limited offensive capability. Three infantry divisions (Brescia, Pavia, Bologna) holding extended siege perimeter.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain and rocky desert (Cyrenaica - Tobruk siege sector)

special_rules: Siege warfare and fortified position assault
Static perimeter defense with extended frontage
Coordination with German forces (DAK) for major operations
Limited counterattack capability with corps reserves

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain and rocky desert (Cyrenaica - Tobruk siege sector)

organizational_summary.unit_composition: Aggregate strength from general Regia Aeronautica Libya records (~400 aircraft maintained). After heavy losses in early 1941 (Operation Compass), reinforced with Rommel's arrival. Operational rate 60% typical for Italian forces in North Africa.
